etymology.description: Originally a pictogram depicting a mouth full of teeth -> phonetic 止(止) (zhǐ, "stop") added to aid pronunciation
etymology.interpretation: The character started as a visual representation of teeth and later incorporated 止(止) as a phonetic component to reinforce its pronunciation while maintaining the original pictographic representation.

examples.chinese: 他每天早上刷齒(他每天早上刷齒)，晚上睡覺前再刷齒(晚上睡覺前再刷齒)。
examples.pinyin: Tā měitiān zǎoshang shuā chǐ, wǎnshàng shuìjiào qián zài shuā chǐ.
examples.english: He brushes his teeth every morning, and brushes them again before bed.

examples.chinese: 医生检查齒(醫生檢查齒)。
小猫露出洁白的齒(小貓露出潔白的齒)，显得十分可爱(顯得十分可愛)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎo māo lùchū jiébái de chǐ, xiǎn de shífēn kě'ài.
examples.english: The little cat shows its white tooth, looking very cute.
